name: sredni
text: The philosophical depth of this story is astounding.

text: Ray's transitioning in the last panel gets me every time...

text: this is the saddest paradox

text: All one eyebrow in the 'finishing a sad story, and following it with a deep, meaningful philosophical question' position, and the other in the 'let's talk us some effing BUSINESS' position.

text: yeah I can't sleep at night for the suffering of people I can't help either

text: inspirational

name: hipjiverobot
text:
The alt text was what made me give this a 5.

"Due to his bad luck, Rustmouth died wealthy and well-regarded."

name: falseprophet
text: Only Onstad could make the precursor to indie cred feel like humanity's universal goal.

name: jackparsons
text:
"Died at 106" - granpa
"Won the Great Outdoor Fight" - pa
Ray's DNA is golden.

name: nutmeg
text: cept for da betes

name: mugi
text: beetus

name: wartooth
text: im wilford brimley, you may recognize me from such movies as cocoon and cocoon: the return.

name: terriblerobot
text: "Welcome to Retardation, A Celebration. I'm Wilford Brimley. Now, let's dispell some rumors. One, retards don't rule the night. They don't rule it. Nobody does. Two, they may not be as strong as apes, but don't look them in the eye. It might make them go into berserker mode. They'll come at you like a whirling dervish of fists and elbows. And you may be saying 'No, no, no', but all they hear is 'Who wants cake?' and trust me, they all do. They all want cake."

name: nicolae
text: Is this the source of Ray's unlimited wealth?

name: earendil
text:
I think he's still making it big off of those hit records from the time he sold his soul to Satan.
Wonder if that expired when he went to hell and left?

name: thatcrazycommie
text: He also sold an ancient porno daguerreotype for six hundred million dollars.

name: spinynorman
text:
Also his momma was so loaded the only store she knew was Neiman Marcus. And he always had the most kickass treats at baseball.

Boy had it easier, has it getting easier, except for the bald spot.

name: farqussus
text: and near brushes with diabetes

name: thescrivener
text: dude no way you know he kept that thing.

name: atticusonline
text: No, he sold it.

name: thesyndicate88
text: 106? That cat must have been dust by the time he finally kicked it.

name: postblank
text: I never knew the police had the autonomy to re-name streets.

name: epicurus
text:
The little things that Chris sneaks into the dialogue like this, things that are not really possible but that people would say and believe, are golden.

This police naming a street is one example, other ones include "had to send her to the doctor to be killed".

name: lastpolarbear
text: Considering they are cats, that one could be accurate.

name: firesign
text:
Subject = character in story told to Philippe by Lie Bot.

Species completely indeterminate. Feline nature not implied.

name: epicurus
text: Thank you firesign, please go back to charting a course for the Kessel run while I check the photon torpedoes.

name: thescrivener
text: This was a Police Street.  By police, for police.  They can name them whatever they want.

name: xiaomimi
text:

Onstad: Happy New Year 2007.

name: tekende
text: "You think I care if a car is upside down? Watch me buy a bagel, from your upside-down car."

text: Panel 6:Another example of getting things done

text:
basically. but it didn't take three hours to tell the story.

text: If it does not involve a train then it is not the blues.

text: Damn Onstad you sure as hell can spin a yarn.
